name: Hotel Indigo

reviews.text: Easily located and centrally located, this hotel is within walking distance of everything from the Natural History Museum to the Parliament buildings, the canal to Sparks Street. The price was reasonable, the rooms clean and nicely decorated. We had issues with temperature control and evening hallway noise but really enjoyed the pool, fitness rooms and hot tub. I found the bed very hard (painfully so) but the rest of my family said they slept well. I would also have preferred a bath tub over a shower but recognize that it's a matter of taste.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel i centrally located but in a boring neighb. The rooms are ok but not more than that, the tv didnt work that well and also not one of the lamps. Something to work on.
reviews.title: Average at a fair rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast not included but available with great coffee. Wifi included in rate.
reviews.title: wonderful stay, very helpful staff

reviews.text: We found this to be a great location for exploring the city. The staff was very helpful in guiding us to where we needed to be and finding a place for our rented bikes. The bar area was nice, not crowded or loud. This was our second time staying at this hotel - we were here a couple of years ago for a visit that was too short and decided to come back. We would stay at this hotel again and again!
reviews.title: Mediocore

reviews.text: The hotel location and staff are great. The main problem was the shower pressure which was way too low (6th floor) and heating which didnt seem to work in my room. The room nicely decorated however faced the inside of the hotel. You would think if I paid full price for a several day stay they would put me in a nicer room with a view.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed for a quick one-night romantic getaway. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and courteous - they had no problems giving us a late check-out. Our room was very nice and clean. It was uniquely decorated with laminate flooring and a whole wall with a large wheat field wallpaper. We had a mini-fridge, large HD flat screen tv, a desk, wireless internet and a sofa chair. The bathroom was very clean with a glass, walk-in shower (no tub). We didn't get to try the restaurant or the pool.
reviews.title: Nice Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: This "quirky", boutique hotel is a nice change from the standard, boring chain hotels.
reviews.title: Clean & attractive hotel, that is a little different, but can still improve

reviews.text: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Indigo while on business. I enjoyed my stay and would return but would take care to ask for a room that was not adjoining another. The sound-proofing was not great and I was only too aware of the couple arguing in the next room. Room was well appointed and clean, but would have liked a little more enthusiasm from the front desk. I thought I was meant to get a daily newspaper but when I asked about it I was offhandedly told that there should be some "over there." I liked the number of plugs available on the desk and the free wi-fi but found the pillows on the bed small. Otherwise the bed was quite comfortable. The restaurant did not have an extensive menu and was a little slow, but met my simple needs.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.text: Good value for money, good location downtown, kinda feels like you're renting someone's apartment! Staff are great, room is always ready on-time. The hotel has been refurbished so it's clean. Some rooms have a small fridge.
reviews.title: Good stay; enjoyed the floors

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed two night in early April 2013. We had a king room on the fourth floor. Upon walking in, we were struck by the floors - hardwood, no carpets - which made everything seem much cleaner and was very much appreciated. The bed was very comfortable, with a firm-ish mattress, and the bathroom was relatively modern with a good-sized walk-in shower. The location of the hotel was ideal for accessing all of the downtown tourist sites, and the neighbourhood quieted down nicely overnight. The windows actually opened, which was a nice touch. The door leading into the hallway was a bit thin, such that we heard more noise from the hallway than we did the street below, but it didn't disturb our sleep. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: functional but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for winterlude. Good location, close to the park where all the icecarving was. Easy to get to the Rideau Canal. Not far to Parliament Hill. Just across the canal to Byward Market. Rooms smallish but clean and all that we needed.
reviews.title: Handy spot

reviews.text: This is a smallish hotel in a great location, near the Parliament Buildings and within walking distance of good restaurants and tourist attractions. The room didn't have carpeting which is nice for people with dust allergies. All rooms are entered from a "court yard" and there is a decent restaurant for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on business & was more than happy with Hotel Indigo. Very clean, good food (& beer) in the restaurant. Pretty well equipped gym, really central so lots within walking distance. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Only negative was I had a room on the 2nd floor so noise from the lobby & street carried at night - lesson learned ask to go higher nxt time.
reviews.title: Flying visit to Ottawa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed one night but would have loved to stay longer. Nice clean room, not the largest but really fine. Gym and sauna open 24 hours, Very friendly staff, all round very pleased. Look forward to staying there next time in Ottawa.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Location is very good. Not far from most of the sites, Byward Market is about a 20 mins walk away. Valet parking only. Lots near by but not worth it. They bed okay but anyone can see that the matress was warped (never seen that before). Surprisingly it was still comfortable. I was on business and the room and wifi more than met my needs. Ate at the bistro, for hotel food it was good and not too expensive. There is construction nearby so get a room on the top floor and either on the front of the hotel, or the back left corner. Right side of the building is loud. I was on the 4th floor and it was still a bother. Also, garbage pick up at 645am under my window. Overall, still above average as they upgraded my room at no cost and without asking.
reviews.title: Above Average

reviews.text: Folks at check in were lovely and warm. I had a room facing the street, and it wasn't too noisy. The rooms have been recently decorated in a unique way (photo mural of a wheat field along one wall). What struck me was that the floors were laminate wood, and there was only a small rug. Seemed rather cold for the still snowy Ottawa spring. The bed was comfortable, and the internet worked great. There is no tub in the bathroom, and the glassed in shower has a step into it.
reviews.title: Fine, not spectacular

reviews.text: The coffee and tea in the room were such low grade quality, and there was only powdered milk for the tea. I found this surprising given the lovely Aveda bathroom products.
reviews.title: An OK Hotel

reviews.text: I had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, and must say that for a hotel that fancies itself a bit more high-end, the restaurant did not match those aspirations. The food was of fairly low quality.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, lacking amenities and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One final note: Housekeeping came knocking at my door at 8:00 in the morning to clean my room. It was one of the earliest stop-bys I've had.
reviews.title: Bess at the front desk is one on the hotels best assets,

reviews.text: By in large this is a fine hotel; only because the hotel is clearly aspiring to be something more, are the faults more apparent.
reviews.title: Favourite hotel when in Ottawa

description: Hotel Indigo is a trendy boutique hotel located in downtown Ottawa and is ideal for those traveling for business or pleasure. Discover what our vibrant neighborhood has to offer! While staying at Hotel Indigo enjoy our indoor pool, whirlpool, 24 hour fitness centre and complimentary high speed internet. Leisure travelers who are seeking a unique hotel experience can escape to our Ottawa hotel, which is conveniently located near a variety of local attractions. Hotel Indigo Ottawa, located in the Ottawa City Centre, places you within walking distance of Rideau Canal, the National Arts Centre and Parliament Hill. Our hotel is just minutes from many local parks, outdoor malls and shopping centres. Hotel Indigo Ottawa is ideal for business travelers since we're located just minutes from companies such as Bell Canada and NAV Canada, as well as many government offices and the Ottawa Convention Centre. Our hotel in downtown Ottawa is also convenient to the British High Commission, the Ontario Court House and the World Exchange Plaza. Guests of the hotel can enjoy our onsite restaurant, Phi Bistro & Bar, where the food is fresh and the service is inspiring.
